page.title: 11THE STATION.
page.content: The station of Abergele and Pensarn is situated on the North Wales coast line which forms the important link between London and Dublin.The use of the station has declined to the point where the closing of the station would not be surprising . The original track was built by George Stephenson for the Chester to Llandudno Junction railway but was later built up to Holyhead and London.At Holyhead the ships would sail to Kingston-Ireland to join up Dublin by rail to London for trade. The track was built in the 1840's along with the station.Many alterations have been made to the station:platforms and sidings were extended in 1883 and a footbridge was constructed at the same time.Widened lines and a new station were brought into use in July 1902.
